intro: Periarrabidaea duckei, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces spherical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
